bug.short_desc: Select all (Control+A, CTRL+A) in table in Chrome and IE does not work

long_desc.thetext:
Steps to reproduce:
Instructions: * open http://demo.qooxdoo.org/current/demobrowser/demo/table/Table.html?qx.theme=qx.theme.Modern * select one row to set focus on the table * press CTRL+A to select all rows * observe result, all rows should be selected
Perform above instructions in both Mozilla Firefox and Google Chrome. Notice that in Mozilla Firefox all rows are selected after pressing CTRL+A where Google Chrome does not.

This affects IE as well (title updated accordingly). Noticed in and 9, both on version 1.6 and trunk.
In IE there seem to be an additional hit: as Ctrl+A is not handled, the event bubbles and the *whole* page text is selected instead, which is rather unexpected.
Current workaround for this second issue, as it is hard to deselect text, is to open an internal (qooxdoo) window, which then steals focus and kills selection.
Any forecast on a possible resolution and/or ideas on what to look for?
Move open issues to RESOLVED – LATER, whose last comment is older than a year.
